channel.title: Botting
channel.description: i want to bot on some new accounts i was wondering how long would it take to get a 99 skill if i bot 24/7 non stop? And also chances of getting caught :O

item.title: Botting
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:6, topic:405777”]Bot in a time span that a normal person can do. Like me I bot anywhere from 6-10hours daily and I haven’t been banned yet o.o and don’t keep it the normal time every day mix it up a bit.

Also don’t just bot do quest, Play on funorb, etc to keep Jagex thinking you aren’t botting.[/quote]

this. also 24/7(suicide) botting is only done to gain money as far as i know, also i would assume they know who gets that money and that if both accounts have the same ip idk why jagex wouldnt ban both accounts. if u use a well made bot, and u bot a responsible amount of hours u shouldnt get caught. botting then playing on the same account for a few more hours isnt that smart, especially if uve been botting for 12+ hours b4 playing. it just adds to the overall play time.

Read full topic

item.title: Botting
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

Bot in a time span that a normal person can do. Like me I bot anywhere from 6-10hours daily and I haven’t been banned yet o.o and don’t keep it the normal time every day mix it up a bit.

Also don’t just bot do quest, Play on funorb, etc to keep Jagex thinking you aren’t botting.

Read full topic

item.title: Botting
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

Get Blitz:

hum any way of not getting detected?

think it through, its common sense… suicide botting will always be detectable if u play 24/7 i would think jagex would assume u are botting especially if u only do one thing for the entire time. who plays runescape 24/7? obviously if u actually do that u should be banned for being so addicted to the game. maybe bot 16/7 it would be a little less detectable.

Read full topic
